name: Saddleborn
desc:
Get a knack for riding or piloting:
  • Chapter I: Animals or Vehicles
  • Chapter II: Monsters
  • Chapter III: An entire herd of animals or monsters

name: Windrider
desc:
When you push yourself to take a traverse or sneak action, you also get increased effect and choose one of the following for the action per chapter:
  • You don't touch the ground
  • You don't make a sound
  • You can't be touched while moving

name: Dabbler
desc: Get +1 point to put in any action rating. At the start of an interlude, you must swap this point around to a new action. It can't take anyr ating higher than 1+ the chapter number.

name: Freesoul
desc: You can escape from any restraint, grab, shackle, hold, or prison cell without rolling, appropriate to chapter. You can conceal this ability if you wish.

name: Lay Burdens
desc: When you enter a populated location, untick 1 segment on all burdens, and you may push your next action for free.

name: Airfeel
desc:
When you camp or start an expedition, you can ask any of the following questions about the next day or so of travel and get a thruthful yes or no answer from the GM. Get increased effect when next acting on the answers:
  • Is it a long, dangerous, or arduous journey?
  • Is the journey defended or contested?
  • Are you currently being pursued, tracked, or hunted?

name: Colortongue
desc: You can understand and speak all languages and read all scripts. When you interact with a living creature that doesn't speak language, you can understand its intents and feelings and get a knack to interact with it socially. At chapter II or higher, you can use this to interact with even non-living creatures, such as magical constructs or the undead.

name: Horizon Sweeper
desc:
Your sense actions have increased effect and aren't affected by:
  • Chapter I: Darkness or time of day
  • Chapter II: Weather or visibility
  • Chapter III: Distance of any kind

name: Memory of the Sole
desc:
Name a location you last set up camp or spent an interlude. The GM will determine the difficulty of the journey there by answering the questions below. When the next scene starts, you and up to ten other willing people can choose to be safely there if you take 2 strain for each 'yes' answer, which could cause you to break. Work backwards to figure out how you got there (the scene doesn't necessarily have to take place the next hour or day, for example).
  • Is it a long, dangerous, or arduous journey?
  • Is the location defended or contested?
  • Are you currently being pursued, tracked, or hunted?

name: Lightspeed
desc: Your next Traverse action has superpowered effect.

name: Gambit of Gaia
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Heartsight
desc:
Close your eyes. You can view a location for 1 minute, anywhere:
  • I: Close by, within shouting distance
  • II: Within a few miles
  • III: Anywhere in Arden Eld
You view the location as if an invisible observer, hearing and seeing everything. You cannot move your point of vision, and your body is immobile and vulnerable while taking this action. You can end it any time. You don’t have to be able to see the location you’re trying to view.

name: Library Organ
desc: Get +1d on study and sense for the rest of the scene, but all other actions are at 0d. At chapter III, also increase all effect from study and sense.

name: Argus
desc:
You get a knack for sensing:
  • I: Hidden objects, paths, tracks, or traps
  • II: Hidden people, monsters, or ambushes
  • III: Invisible or metaphysical objects or forces, such as the flow of magic

name: Midnight Eyes
desc: You can see in the dark, which could make your risk and effect better. Your study and sense actions get increased effect in darkness. At Chapter III or higher, you can see anything close by in good detail without the use of your eyes.

name: Unhinge
desc: When you push a desperate action, it also gains increased effect.

name: Dark Clarity
desc:
You may study the ambient emotional state of:
  • I: One person close by
  • II: One person or monster close by
  • III: All people or monsters close by
You get an impression of how they are feeling and what the strongest emotion they are feeling is. Your next action including your target(s) that can act on this information gets +1 boon or increased effect.

name: Possession
desc: Ask a presence inside you for advice. The GM will answer as the presence. Get +1d on the next action that follows that advice.

name: Instinctive
desc:
Describe a course of action to the GM you plan to take this session. You will receive an answer that is truthful, if unclear, that comes from a feeling. The GM can choose from the following options:
  • Wheel (good/positive outcomes)
  • Stone (bad/negative outcomes)
  • Chaos (a mix of good and bad outcomes)

name: Geist
desc:
When you are able to touch someone skin to skin, even if you break contact, you can see through their eyes and experience their sensations and ambient emotional state, though you can do little but observe, and they are not aware of your presence. The effect can be accessed:
  • I: Until the end of the scene
  • II: Until the end of the expedition
  • III: Indefinitely
The effect is canceled when you use this ability again, and while you’re concentrating on it, you cannot do anything yourself except sit in quiet focus, otherwise the effect breaks. A player character must be willing, and you may need a roll to be able to touch a hostile, unaware, or unwilling character.

name: Terrible Truth
desc: Increase the effect of your next Study action to superpowered

name: Gambit of the Outsider
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: True Grit
desc: When you break, you remain in control of your character for the rest of the scene. If you would remain broken longer than that (you have 3 burdens for example) this effect ends at the end of the scene.

name: Iron Jaw
desc: You can’t suffer critical strain (take 4 strain instead)

name: Volcanic
desc: When someone or something harms an ally in your presence, you can trigger this ability to get +1d or increased effect (choose) on all actions against them for the rest of the scene

name: Hammersoul
desc: Your Smash actions have increased effect when you’re exhausted.

name: Overpower
desc: You can push by taking 2 strain instead of spending effort for Endure and Smash actions

name: The Tower
desc: While you’re at maximum strain, characters can aid you without spending effort. If you break, all characters that witness it recover 1 effort.

name: Force of Will
desc: You can choose to automatically treat your next Command action roll against another character as a 6. The GM can decide a character is too strong willed for this to work on them, forcing you to roll normally, but if they do, regain 2 effort after that roll resolves. It always works on foes from a lower chapter than you.

name: Half Light
desc: When you gather information about violence or possible threats, you can use Endure, Smash, or Command

name: The Wall
desc: This scene only, reduce all strain suffered by you or an ally of your choice by 1, to a minimum of 1

name: Make Total Destroy
desc: Increase the effect of your next Smash action to superpowered

name: Gambit of The Storm Lord
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Clarity
desc: If you break, regain all effort, and you can push your next action for free

name: Scargoat
desc: +1 max strain per Burden you have

name: Blood Scent
desc: You get a knack for tracking or intimidating anyone or anything that’s wounded

name: Go for a Walk
desc: When you separate from the group to do something alone, you can trigger this ability to get +1d and increased effect on your action. ‘Cut to black’ and roll the action ‘off-screen’, then cut back to when you return to the group, describing what happened.

name: Cornered
desc: When you are outnumbered in a tense or violent situation, leading team actions does not cost effort for you.

name: Lurk
desc: When the GM describes a scene, you can choose to be there, hidden, appropriate to chapter. Don’t worry about how you got there.

name: It's Nothing
desc: During Heal Burdens, heal 2 extra ticks on a burden of your choice if nobody helps you heal burdens. Heal 1 tick on two burdens if someone does help you heal, instead of just one burden. If you do so, you can’t help other people heal burdens.

name: Crack Shell
desc: When you’re exhausted, you can take aid actions without spending effort

name: Bishop
desc: When you set someone up, that person gets both +1d and increased effect on the set up roll.

name: Wick
desc: Increase the power of your next Excel action to superpowered

name: Gambit of Arenheir
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Mirrormask
desc: You can always tell if someone is lying if you can see their face, though the nature of the lie is unclear. At chapter III, you only need to hear someone’s voice or read something they have written.

name: Mercurio
desc: You can change your appearance completely in only a few moments by spending 1 effort, including height, weight, gender presentation, etc. Anyone in view of you can witness you change. You must appear as Kin (a person), but you could be a different Kintype, and otherwise everything else is up to you. This effect lasts until you camp, or until you eat or drink something, and while active you get a knack for impersonating your new form, although if you’re trying to impersonate a specific person, people who know them will see through your disguise up close. At chapter III, this effect no longer costs effort if it's only used once a scene.

name: Mockingbird
desc: You get a knack for mimicking sounds or voices.

name: Fast Friends
desc:
You can choose to automatically treat your next charm action roll as a 6. If you do, its effects only last:
  • I: 1 minute
  • II: an hour
  • III a whole day
After the duration expires, its target(s) realize they were manipulated.

name: The Big Show
desc: Critical hits on excel, charm, or sneak actions regain 2 effort for all party members who witness your feats

name: Habitual Line Stepper
desc:
You instantly disappear from sight and re-appear somewhere:
  • I: Nearby
  • II: Within two or three hundred paces
  • III: Within a mile
You don’t have to see your destination, but you are shunted back to your starting point if it’s occupied or obstructed (like trying to hop into solid rock, for example).

name: Quickfingers
desc: Name a number of objects nearby equal to the chapter number that you can see that could fit or carry in one or both hands. By the start of the next scene, you have possession of them. If you stole them, the person you stole it from will find out within the hour

name: Ridi Pagliacci
desc: You can invoke each of your burdens instead of spending 1 effort, once a session for each burden

name: Exuent
desc: When you lead an action to flee or escape trouble, don’t spend effort.

name: Step of the Smiling Few
desc: Increase the power of your next Sneak action to superpowered

name: Gambit of the Laughing God
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Rarefied
desc: You have a knack for actions involving people considered highborn or high class. However, if you use this knack, all actions involving people considered low class or lowborn are 0d at best until the end of the session.

name: Private Tutor
desc: You've had specialized training. Choose any action. You can re-roll any ‘1’s you roll as part of that action, keeping the new result. However, choose one other action that you neglected - you must re-roll any ‘6’s as part of this action, keeping the new result.

name: Silver Spoon
desc: You can never be accused of trespassing except by someone considered high rank or high class (a manager, a noble, a military officer, etc), appropriate to chapter. This effect does not extend to anyone else with you, but get +1d on rolls to cover for them. At chapter II, you can cover for one extra person without question, and at chapter III you can cover for anyone you like within reason.

name: Trust the Fund
desc: You always have enough in your pockets to sway someone when you try to gain access, assets, or information. If you do, gain +1d or increased effect, but it’s incredibly obvious that you’re bribing them.

name: Special Reserve
desc: Get +1d or increased effect when you gather information or recall info on something rare, expensive, or hard to find.

name: Ivory Tower
desc: When the GM describes a location, monster, person, or historical event, you can ask the GM for an additional detail only an expert would know and get a truthful answer. Get +1d the next time you act on the answer.

name: Honor Student
desc: If you forgo healing burdens, you can tick an extra segment on an ambition. If you take one other character along with you to observe, they can also tick a segment on their own ambitions.

name: Passionate
desc: You always have a secret passion ambition you can work on, something you’ve wanted to try but never been able to. It’s a 12 segment ambition clock that gives 3 xp for completing it, and can be worked on for free each interlude. If you complete your passion, you can pursue a new one.

name: Unflappable
desc: Leading actions to Command or Charm a large group costs no effort for you

name: Perfect Grace
desc: Increase the effect of your next Charm action to superpowered.

name: Gambit of the Bronze Queen
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Push Through
desc: You can take 1 strain instead of spending effort to take aid actions, which cannot be reduced or ignored.

name: Divine Luck
desc: When you take strain as a consequence, roll a 1d6 fortune roll. On 6, reduce the strain suffered to 0 (even critical strain).

name: Illuminate
desc: Your actions have +1 boon or increased effect (choose) with or against characters or creatures that trust you.

name: Untangle
desc: When you help someone else lift burdens, you increase their segments healed by +1, and heal 1 segment yourself

name: Pangloss
desc: When you fail a desperate action, your next action can be pushed without spending effort.

name: A Better Way
desc:
When you study to understand how something or someone is hurt or broken, or tinker to fix something, get +1d or increased effect. This ability works without effect loss on:
  • I: One person or a small object
  • II: A whole group of people or a large object
  • III: A whole town, or a massive object such as a train, huge machine, etc

name: Mender
desc:
You can charm or tinker to heal someone’s strain. Check the final result:
  • 0-3 - Characters can spend 1 effort to heal 1 strain
  • 4-5 - Character heals 1 strain
  • 6 - Character heals 2 strain
  • 6,6 - Character heals 4 strain

name: Encourage
desc: Spend a use of this ability to use aid without spending effort or exposing yourself to consequences

name: Iron Cutting
desc: At the end of each interlude, you can tick 2 segments total, split between any ambition, project clock, or ritual clock of your choice, even those belonging to another character.

name: Heart Forge
desc: Increase the effect of your next Tinker action to superpowered

name: Gambit of the Forge Titan
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Strike the Road
desc: The first team action you lead in a session costs you 0 effort

name: Crush Limiter
desc: You can give your next action superpowered effect, but take a burden at the end of the scene.

name: Luck as a Constant
desc: When you critical hit, regain all effort, heal all strain, and mark 1 xp • All in - Using Aid to help a character taking a desperate action costs 0 effort for you

name: All In
desc: Using Aid to help a character taking a desperate action costs 0 effort for you

name: Joyluck Wind Thrower
desc: When you take a desperate action, you can take +1d on the action. If you do, treat any die less than a 6 as a 1.

name: The Sun
desc: Gain increased effect on all actions for the rest of the scene

name: Coordinate
desc: Aiding you on team actions costs 0 effort

name: Heart of Hearts
desc: You can flash back to a scene from your past or hometown and describe how your memory of that time inspires you in the current moment. You can treat your next roll as though you rolled a critical hit (6,6). You can only use this ability three times ever, and when you expend its third use, replace this power with another one.

name: Team Player
desc: When any ally sets you up, you have increased effect on the roll

name: Brave Destiny
desc: Increase the effect of the next team action you take to superpowered.

name: Gambit of The Hundred Sword God
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Contingency
desc: You can use this power to ‘flash back’ in time to tell the GM how you prepared for a situation. You can use this ability before or after any action roll to do one of the following: Set up a character for the next action (even yourself), resist consequences of something that just happened by taking strain, even for another character, increase effect or lower risk. To do so, however, you need to be able to tell the GM how you prepared and also make fortune roll using one of your actions to see how well your preparation went. On a 4+ gain the expected effect, on a 6 choose an extra effect, and on a 1-3 you had to abandon the plan (this ability has no effect this scene and regain 1 use).

name: Swoon
desc: When you would take consequences as a result of your actions, you have may another willing character nearby take the consequences instead of you after you learn what they are. If they do, they take 1 xp.

name: Immaculate
desc: Get a knack for situations where being dressed appropriately would help you (disguises, uniforms, outfits, formalwear, etc), appropriate to chapter.

name: Beg, Borrow, or Steal
desc:
When you need the right tool for the job (a disguise, a tool, a weapon, a portable boat, a ladder) you can choose to have it right now. The tool’s power, type, and rarity depends on chapter, and it lasts until the end of the session, or until you use this ability again. Gain +1d on actions using the tool, but the GM chooses one:
  • It was stolen from someone, who will track you down by next interlude
  • It’s poor quality and breaks after the scene is over
  • It gets you into trouble after the scene is over (it attracts attention, there’s an unwanted side effect, it leads you somewhere you weren’t expecting to go)

name: Fruitful
desc:
You have a contact or family member in every populated location. Define this person with the GM and pick one (choose carefully):
  • not in trouble with the law
  • reliable
  • won’t need a favor
Roll +1d on actions where your contact could help you.

name: Faust
desc: The next time you roll, treat all 1s as 6s. The next time you roll after that, treat all 6s as 1s.

name: Make It Work
desc: You may use your highest rated action for any single action with normal effectiveness (charming a door to open for example). Explain to the GM how you’re doing this. At chapter III, you don’t need to explain.

name: Coordinator
desc: You get 2 xp for pursuing a group ambition instead of 1, and gain +1d when working on a group ambition.

name: Ladder Climber
desc: You can pursue ambitions twice during an interlude, but only if you pursue different ambitions.

name: Golden Hand
desc: Increase the effect of your next Command action to superpowered.

name: Gambit of the Weeper
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Parable
desc: Twice a session, you can ask the GM about any path of action ahead of you. The GM will answer as truthfully as possible with the phrase ‘This is the path of ____”, with the blank part being an animal, plant, or natural element (fire/water/earth/wind) that the GM feels best fits the situation. Gain +1d when next acting on the answer.

name: Pacifist
desc: If you leave a scene of violence without harming anyone, heal 1 strain and regain 1 effort.

name: Long Memory
desc: Gain +1d on rolls to gather information about any event that happened more than ten years ago. At chapter III, if it happened in your lifetime, you can also tell the GM you remember it clearly or were actually there and can’t fail the roll (treat a 1-3 as a 4+).

name: Been Around
desc: Unless they draw a weapon, nobody younger than you can harm, restrain, or touch you in any way unless you let them. This effect ignores chapter.

name: Spinner of Tales
desc: You get a 12 segment ambition clock that you can work on for free each interlude, to tell a story from your past. When the clock is complete, a character of your choice that listened to you can improve an action by 1. A character can only gain this benefit once.

name: Pillar of Rock
desc: Until you use violence or coerce someone or something in a session, reduce all strain taken from other people by 1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Saltbelly
desc: Gain +1d for the rest of the session against anyone that shares a meal, shares a drink, or plays a game of skill against you.

name: Mentor
desc: You can forgo working on your own ambitions to come along and help someone else with theirs. If you do, they tick 1 more segment and gain +1d.

name: Reputation
desc:
When you enter a populated area you haven’t visited before, you can decide that people there have heard of you. This gives you +1d to interact with them socially for the rest of the session, but anyone who wants to find or track you can find you easily. This works on:
  • I. Any town
  • II. Any city or small village
  • III. Anywhere

name: The Mountain
desc: Increase the effect of your next Endure action to superpowered.

name: Gambit of Tsumi
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Xenoclash
desc: Choose two actions. Once a session, you can push each of these actions without spending effort. Describe the unique talents or abilities that allow you to do this.

name: Gaia Compass
desc:
You have a knack for navigation. You always know the distance and direction of the nearest
  • (I) village
  • (II) town
  • (III) settlement
of any kind. You can sense dungeons within a few miles, and get a bad feeling when one is about to surface.

name: Open Up
desc: You can spend time with one other character during an interlude trying to understand each other. If you do, you can each aid each other once without spending effort during the next expedition.

name: Bloom
desc: Any character can set out a unique ambition clock once with 4 segments to try and learn a little of your language and customs. If they finish the clock, they gain 1 xp and they can understand your language, allowing you to communicate with them privately. You can decide whether an NPC speaks your language or not.

name: Earth Glide
desc:
You have an unusual way of moving due to skills, magical talent, or anatomy. You gain a knack for movement through certain terrain and don’t suffer reduced effect moving through it. Pick one per chapter:
  • Forests
  • Oceans
  • Mountains
  • Snow
  • Swamps
  • Deserts

name: Tour Guide
desc: When a character works on ambitions or a project, they can bring you along. Roll a 1d6 fortune roll. On a 1, despite your best efforts you don’t help, giving -1d on the roll. On a 2-5, your unique insights help, giving +1d on the roll. On a 6, you offer a perspective that both gives +1d and allows them to tick 1 more segment.

name: Earth Speech
desc:
You can speak and understand something unusual, and have normal effect while doing so. Your conversation partners might not speak language, or be particularly eloquent. Whether they are actually talking back or not is up to the tone of your game. Pick one per chapter:
  • Animals
  • Plants
  • Rocks
  • Weapons
  • Tools
  • Vehicles

name: Centered
desc: You have a unique cuisine, or a unique eating or drinking stricture or habit. When you share it with someone or explain it to them, they gain +1d to set you up for the rest of the session, and you get +1d on the next roll involving them.

name: Resourceful
desc: You can bring one more piece of loose gear with you on an expedition.

name: The Wave
desc: Increase the effect of your next Sense action to superpowered.

name: Gambit of the Formless
desc: Take a power from another Bond.

name: Improvise
desc:
You can push a smash roll for free if you can somehow use something that’s not a weapon from your environment. This could also increase or decrease effect, depending on the item. You can use something:
  • I: Small, like a vase or stool
  • II: Large, like a piece of furniture or a door
  • III: Massive, like a horse cart or boulder

name: Punching Bag
desc: If you take strain from anything, everyone else gets increased effect against that thing for the rest of the scene.

name: Best Efforts
desc: If you fail a set-up roll, you can take 1 strain to re-roll it, taking the second result. You can do this any number of times.

name: Bright Eyed
desc: At the start of each session, you may choose another character to look up to. You can aid that character without spending effort this session (you still share in any consequences), but aiding other characters costs 2 effort.

name: Follow the Leader
desc: Make an action roll using any character’s action rating for that action. Describe how that character taught or inspired you.

name: Lost Cat
desc: If you invoked your burdens to get into trouble during a session, you can choose a character that came to your aid and let them mark 1 xp at the end of a session.

name: Rash
desc: Once a session, if you boast about your success on a roll before you roll, you can force yourself to roll at a max of 0d, but you regain 1 effort after the roll. If you actually succeed (4+), everyone else can regain 1 effort as well.

name: Underdog
desc: When you become exhausted, your next action gains +1d and increased effect.

name: Heart Held Dream
desc: You gain +1d to work on any ambition clock that’s 10 segments or longer. When you finish such a clock, you can lift a burden, or allow an ally to lift a burden.

name: The Lobster
desc: If you break, your next action can be made normally, even while broken, and gains superpowered effect.

name: Gambit of The Wanderers
desc: Take a power from another Bond.
